intro: Quebrachia morongii, commonly known as the Andean quebracho, is a deciduous tree native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its thick, rugged bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by elliptical, woody fruits. Quebrachia morongii is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Its wood is hard and durable, making it valuable for traditional uses and craftsmanship.
